action.action-desc: Mr. Keating introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To ensure that certain short-term rentals are equipped with a smoke detector and a carbon monoxide detector, and for other purposes.

section.header: Smoke and carbon monoxide detectors required

subsection.text: No person may rent or offer for rent, or facilitate the rental of, a short-term rental unless such short-term rental is equipped with a smoke detector and a carbon monoxide detector.
The Federal Trade Commission may promulgate, in accordance with section 553 of title 5, United States Code, such regulations as may be necessary to carry out this section.

paragraph.header: Unfair or deceptive acts or practices
paragraph.text: A violation of this section or a regulation promulgated under this section shall be treated as a violation of a regulation under section 18(a)(1)(B) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 57a(a)(1)(B)) regarding unfair or deceptive acts or practices.

The Federal Trade Commission shall enforce this section and the regulations promulgated under this section in the same manner, by the same means, and with the same jurisdiction, powers, and duties as though all applicable terms and provisions of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 41 et seq.) were incorporated into and made a part of this section. Any person who violates this section or a regulation promulgated under this section shall be subject to the penalties and entitled to the privileges and immunities provided in the Federal Trade Commission Act.

subsection.text: Subsection (a) shall take effect on the date that is 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act.

subparagraph.text: means the temporary provision of a room, building, or other lodging facility; and
does not include the provision of a meeting room, banquet services, or catering services.

paragraph.text: The term short-term rental means a property, including a single-family dwelling or a unit in a condominium, cooperative, or time-share, that provides covered services (either with respect to the entire property or a part of the property)—

subparagraph.text: for periods shorter than 30 consecutive days; and
promoted, advertised, or marketed in interstate commerce or sold in interstate commerce.
